name: Greek Salad on Roasted Garlic French Bread
description: Buttery toasted garlic bread is topped with fresh, crisp Greek salad, and served with tart tzatziki sauce.
recipeIngredient: 1 (4 ounce) package Idahoan® Roasted Garlic Flavored Mashed Potatoes
½ pint cherry tomatoes, cut in half
1 cup cucumber, peeled and sliced into 1/4-inch thickness and cut into quarters
1 medium red onion, chopped into thin slices and soaked 10 minutes in small bowl of ice water to reduce sharpness
¾ cup kalamata olives, pitted and sliced
¾ cup crumbled feta cheese, for topping
1 pinch Salt and pepper, to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the dry package of Idahoan Roasted Garlic Potatoes with the butter until blended. Slice the French bread length wise and generously spread with the roasted garlic mixture. Toast under the broiler until butter spread is melted and toasted on top. (You can also grill the Garlic Bread--see footnote.)

Greek Salad: Drain onion from ice water and pat dry with paper towels. In a large bowl combine all salad ingredients, except cheese. Top the French bread with the Greek salad and sprinkle cheese over top. Serve with Tzatziki sauce.
Tzatziki Sauce: In a medium bowl, combine Greek yogurt, cucumber, lemon juice, garlic, and dill. Stir until well combined. Taste and season with salt and pepper.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Greek Salad on Roasted Garlic French Bread

review.reviewBody: Great flavor but.... It calls for a POUND of butter and that's for just 1 loaf of french bread. I almost fell over when I read that. 1/2 lb is plenty!!! Next time I will buy the tzatziki at Trader Joe's or COSTCO etc. They carry it and it's delicious so just cuts down on time. What I loved about this recipe is the 1st ingredient - a package of roasted garlic flavored mash potatoes. What a neat idea and it really added to the flavor immensely! I think I will try that next time I make garlic bread. The salad served over the roasted garlic bread was a great combo. Much better than just serving the salad alone. Very good but very time consuming. Start chopping now;-)
